chapter.p: 1The word that Isaiah son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem:

ul.li1: 2And it shall happen in the future of the days
the mountain of the houseOr “temple” of Yahweh shall be established;
it will be among the highestLiterally “head” of the mountains,
ul.li2: and it shall be raised from the hills.
ul.li1: All of the nations shall travel to him;
ul.li2: 3many peoples shall come.
ul.li1: And they shall say,
“Come, let us go up to the mountain of Yahweh,
ul.li2: to the houseOr “temple” of the God of Jacob,
ul.li1: and may he teach us part of his ways,
ul.li2: and let us walk in his paths.”
ul.li1: For instruction shall go out from Zion,
ul.li2: and the word of Yahweh from Jerusalem.
ul.li1: 4He shall judge between the nations
ul.li2: and he shall arbitrate for many peoples.
ul.li1: They shall beat their swords into ploughshares
ul.li2: and their spears into pruning hooks.
ul.li1: A nation shall not lift up a sword against a nation,
ul.li2: and they shall not learn war again.

ul.li1: 5House of Jacob, come and let us walk in the light of Yahweh.
6For you have forsaken your people, house of Jacob,
because they are fullPossibly “of diviners” was part of the original text here from the east,
ul.li2: and of soothsayers like the Philistines,
and they make alliancesLiterally “they clap hands” with the offspring of foreigners.
ul.li1: 7And its land is filled with silver and gold,
ul.li2: and there is no end to its treasures;
ul.li1: and its land is filled with horses,
ul.li2: and there is no end to its chariots.
ul.li1: 8Its land is filled with idols;
ul.li2: they bow down to the work of theirHebrew “his” hands,
to what they made with theirHebrew “his” fingers.
ul.li1: 9So humanity is humbled;
ul.li2: everyone is humbled,
and you must not forgive them.
ul.li1: 10Enter into the rock
ul.li2: and hide yourself in the dust
ul.li1: from the presence of the terror of Yahweh
ul.li2: and from the glory of his majesty.
ul.li1: 11The haughty eyesLiterally “eyes of the haughtiness” of humanity willThe Hebrew is singular be brought low,
ul.li2: and the pride of everyone will be humbled,
ul.li1: and Yahweh alone will be exalted on that day.
12For there is a day for Yahweh of hosts
ul.li2: against all of the proud and the lofty
and against all that is lifted up and humble,Or “it will be humbled”
ul.li1: 13and against all the lofty and lifted up cedars of Lebanon,
ul.li2: and against all the large trees of Bashan,
ul.li1: 14and against all the high mountains,
ul.li2: and against all the lofty hills,
ul.li1: 15and against every kind of high tower,
ul.li2: and against every kind of fortified wall,
ul.li1: 16and against all the ships of Tarshish,
ul.li2: and against all the ships of desire.
ul.li1: 17And the haughtiness of the people shall be humbled,
ul.li2: and the pride of everyone shall be brought low,
ul.li1: and Yahweh alone will be exalted on that day.
18And the idols shall pass away entirely,
19and they will enter into the caves of the rocks
ul.li2: and into the holes of the ground
ul.li1: from the presence of the terror of Yahweh
ul.li2: and from the glory of his majesty
ul.li1: when he risesLiterally “in his rising” to terrify the earth.
20On that day humanity will throw away its idols of silver
ul.li2: and its idols of gold,
ul.li3: which they made for it to worship,
ul.li2: to the rodentsOr “moles” and to the bats—
ul.li1: 21to enter into the crevices of the rocks
ul.li2: and into the clefts of the crags
ul.li1: from the presence of the terror of Yahweh
ul.li2: and from the glory of his majesty,
ul.li1: when he risesLiterally “in his rising” to terrify the earth.
22Turn away from humanity,
ul.li2: who has breath in its nostrils,Hebrew “nostril”
ul.li1: for byOr “in” what is it esteemed?
